translation.en: -[woman laughing] -[Jon] I don't know.
translation.ja: 〝クッキーを食べて〞

translation.en: -There we go. Chefs everywhere. -[woman] It says, "everything."
translation.ja: 全ての物に名前を付けた

translation.en: -Yeah. -Roy likes it.
translation.ja: ロイの好みだ

translation.en: [Roy] Like, you took my words too literally.
translation.ja: 何でも言葉どおり

translation.en: I heard you were here before they even opened.
translation.ja: 以前もここに？

translation.en: I grew up right here in this area. This store here--
translation.ja: ここで育った ここ？

translation.en: -This was my Baskin-Robbins. Yeah. -This was his Baskin-Robbins. -Bittersweet. -I have mixed feelings.
translation.ja: アイスの店だったから 少し残念

translation.en: But no, this was my Baskin-Robbins, but I'm so happy she's here.
translation.ja: いや 彼女の店になってうれしいよ

translation.en: I've been involved with Christina for a long time.
translation.ja: クリスティーナ･トシ 彼女とは旧知だ

translation.en: I mean, her first book tour, we did at Chego.
translation.ja: クリスティーナ･トシ 最初の本の宣伝をした 最初の本の宣伝をした

translation.en: [Christina] You have this book. The publisher's like,
translation.ja: 出版社に 宣伝のことを聞かれた 〝モモフク･ミルク･ バー〞

translation.en: "How are you gonna promote it?" [laughs]
translation.ja: 出版社に 宣伝のことを聞かれた 〝モモフク･ミルク･ バー〞 〝モモフク･ミルク･ バー〞

translation.en: And you're like, "I have this one friend in LA. -Maybe I can call him and see." -That's great.
translation.ja: だから“ＬＡの友人に 相談する”と答えた

translation.en: So I'm like, "Roy." And he's like, -"We'll do old-school bake-sale style." -Sale. "I got a folding table. We'll put you out on the street."
translation.ja: ロイは学校のバザー風に 通りで本を売ろうと提案した

translation.en: It's like, if you're gonna learn how to cook for a bake sale,
translation.ja: バザーのために お菓子を焼く人が

translation.en: -who would you want as your secret weapon? -[Roy] Yeah.
translation.ja: 興味を持って集まるよね？

translation.en: -For you to get perspective-- -I grew up on bake sales. -[Roy] I know, that's your whole-- -It is my tried-and-true.
translation.ja: 私もバザーの焼き菓子を 参考にしてきた

translation.en: I will pull over the side of the road
translation.ja: よく道端に車を停めて

translation.en: to go to a bake sale and spend $20 and get baked goods that run the gamut.
translation.ja: 20ドル分の焼き菓子を バザーで買うの

translation.en: So we wanted to use this to, like--
translation.ja: イメージは…

translation.en: Take back the bake sale.
translation.ja: バザーよ

translation.en: Take back the bake sale, and also offer something.
translation.ja: 足を止めてもらって

translation.en: You know what? Just pause, and then let's try to make a good cookie, make a good brownie.
translation.ja: おいしいお菓子の焼き方を 学んでもらう

translation.en: -My favorite cookie… -[Jon] Uh-huh. has been my favorite cookie at Milk Bar since the very beginning.
translation.ja: ミルク･バーには 定番のクッキーがあるの

translation.en: It was the cornflake, chocolate chip, marshmallow cookie.
translation.ja: それを作りましょう

translation.en: [Jon] It's really good.
translation.ja: いいね

translation.en: Look at how much cornflake crunch goes into this cookie.
translation.ja: コーンフレークも入れる

translation.en: -Goes into this. Yes. -Yeah.
translation.ja: なるほど

translation.en: [Christina] This is caramelized cornflakes. It's cornflakes. There's some sugar, some salt, some milk powder.
translation.ja: 砂糖や塩やミルクパウダーで キャラメル味にする

translation.en: You know, people are always really scared of salt in their baked goods.
translation.ja: 焼き菓子に 塩は合わないようで

translation.en: -You need salt and you need acid. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 酸と共に必要な物なの

translation.en: But making anything taste good requires that balance.
translation.ja: 味のバランスでうまくなる

translation.en: -This is cultured butter. -[Jon] That gives you acid, the culture?
translation.ja: 発酵バターよ 酸味を？

translation.en: It gives you a bit of acid, but the thing a lot of home cooks don't think about is
translation.ja: むしろ それよりも 膨らし粉と重曹が その役割を果たすわ

translation.en: that your baking powder and baking soda, which are what you use for leavener,
translation.ja: 膨らし粉と重曹が その役割を果たすわ その２つにも酸味があるの

translation.en: that's where you get the acid.
translation.ja: その２つにも酸味があるの

translation.en: [Jon] I don't understand. Wait.
translation.ja: そうなの？

translation.en: Baking powder and baking soda. Can you tell me the difference?
translation.ja: ２つの違いは？

translation.en: Okay, so baking powder is a leavener.
translation.ja: 膨らし粉は酸味があり

translation.en: It gives acid. -[Jon] Okay. -It also helps with texture.
translation.ja: 生地を膨らませてまとめる

translation.en: And baking powder is typically double-acting,
translation.ja: そして２つの反応をするの

translation.en: so it activates as a leavener when it hits heat the first time.
translation.ja: 熱を加えると膨らむのが １つ目の反応で

translation.en: If it hits another acid, it will react again.
translation.ja: 別の酸との反応で再び膨らむ

translation.en: -As a leavener? -[Christina] It'll lift again.
translation.ja: ２回も？

translation.en: So what would you add to baking powder to make it lift?
translation.ja: そのために 別の酸を加えるの？

translation.en: This is a good one! You know the science fair? -And you build the volcano? -Yes, the volcano.
translation.ja: 科学の実験で 火山を作ったでしょ？

translation.en: -Right. -Baking powder, vinegar.
translation.ja: 膨らし粉と酢で爆発

translation.en: -Vinegar in there because it's acid. -[whooshing] Yeah.
translation.ja: 酢は酸だからね

translation.en: I gotcha. Mentos and Diet Coke.
translation.ja: 酢は酸だからね “メントスとコーラ”か

translation.en: -Same. Similar. -Same thing.
translation.ja: “メントスとコーラ”か お腹で実験できるわね

translation.en: -You can feel it happening in here. -Yes.
translation.ja: お腹で実験できるわね

translation.en: [Christina] So we add the light brown sugar and granulated sugar.
translation.ja: ブラウンシュガーと グラニュー糖を入れる

translation.en: The secret to any great chocolate chip cookie is the dark vanilla extract.
translation.ja: 隠し味は 黒いバニラエッセンス

translation.en: But you'll also use the white vanilla for other things.
translation.ja: あとで白いのも使うよね

translation.en: -Look at--I like that you came in ready. -[Jon] Yeah. Yeah.
translation.ja: それは とてもいい質問だわ

translation.en: -That creamy vanilla is birthday vibe. -[Jon] Yeah. -It's the fake vanilla. Yeah, okay. -That's dreamy, fake vanilla,
translation.ja: 白いのは 誕生日ケーキにぴったりなの

translation.en: which I would never use, baking these cookies.
translation.ja: これには使わない

translation.en: But we cream this sucker in total for ten minutes, which is unheard of.
translation.ja: 10分も混ぜ続けるなんて 聞いたことないでしょう？

translation.en: So in your style of baking, are you using metric? Are you using pounds?
translation.ja: 使うのはグラム？ それともポンド？

translation.en: We're using metric. We use weight to the gram.
translation.ja: 分量はグラム数で量る

translation.en: -[Roy] Yeah. -If it's a small amount, to the tenth of the 100th of a gram.
translation.ja: ミリグラム単位まで使うわ

translation.en: But most home-baking recipes are by cups and teaspoons. -They are. -Is it part of the problem?
translation.ja: ほとんどのレシピは カップとスプーンだ

translation.en: It's always part of the problem.
translation.ja: それが問題

translation.en: -With the bread, it's all… Like with-- -Yeah.
translation.ja: パンのレシピは…

translation.en: -Bread is all grams and weighed in metric. -Has to be weighed in metric.
translation.ja: 全てグラム数で書いてあるね

translation.en: [Christina] You don't need a crazy gem scale. You just need something.
translation.ja: 精密なはかりは必要ないわ

translation.en: If all three of us made a cup of flour, -it'd weigh different across the board. -That's right.
translation.ja: 誰が量っても どうせ誤差が出る

translation.en: When we write our cookbooks, the publishers maybe hate me a little bit,
translation.ja: 出版社は嫌がるだろうけど

translation.en: but I'm like, "No, we're gonna give it to them in grams
translation.ja: 私はグラムを使うわ

translation.en: 'cause that's how we do it, and we're not going to be a part of the bad bake sales.
translation.ja: だってそれが 私たちのやり方なの

translation.en: Yeah.
translation.ja: 確かに

translation.en: -All right, where did you put my egg? -[Roy] I got it here.
translation.ja: 卵はどこ？ ここだよ

translation.en: Amazing.
translation.ja: すごい

translation.en: So we want it to aerate for sure
translation.ja: 空気を十分に含ませたい

translation.en: because the second you add that egg yolk, it forces the emulsification
translation.ja: 卵黄を加えると バターと砂糖の 乳化作用が起きるわ

translation.en: -of the butter and the sugar. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 乳化作用が起きるわ

translation.en: [Christina] It strengthens that bond. And we need this to be super strong
translation.ja: その結びつきを強くしたいの

translation.en: because you know when your cookies… Some of it bakes out lacy and flat -and you can see the butter baking out? -Yeah, yeah.
translation.ja: クッキーがレース状になって バターが焦げる理由は

translation.en: It's because you didn't take enough time here.
translation.ja: この時間が少ないせいよ

translation.en: [Jon] Yeah.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: Speaking of lacy cookies, there are good lacy cookies.
translation.ja: “レースクッキー” というのもあるよね

translation.en: -The chocolate chip ones that are-- -Oh, yeah.
translation.ja: “レースクッキー” というのもあるよね ええ

translation.en: -[Roy] That are crispy on the edges. -Oh, yeah.
translation.ja: 周りがカリカリなやつ

translation.en: How do you get that cookie versus just a regular chocolate chip cookie?
translation.ja: 普通のクッキーとは 作り方が違うの？

translation.en: So when you're making that kind of cookie,
translation.ja: わざわざレース状にするのよ

translation.en: -and you want it to be purposefully lacy-- -Almost a palmiers texture, right?
translation.ja: わざわざレース状にするのよ 例えばパルミエ

translation.en: [Christina] You're not playing this crazy whipping game. It's not about giving it aeration.
translation.ja: ただ空気を加え続ける わけじゃない

translation.en: It's just about the ratio of flour to sugar to butter. And it'll naturally bake out.
translation.ja: 粉と砂糖とバターの分量で 加減をするの

translation.en: -Yeah. Because the melted-- -What are those Pepperidge Farm ones
translation.ja: 粉と砂糖とバターの分量で 加減をするの ペパリッジファームの―

translation.en: -that they dip in chocolate? -Yeah. Oh!
translation.ja: ペパリッジファームの―

translation.en: -Those are really good. -[Christina] Why can't I bake those?
translation.ja: クッキーが理想

translation.en: The most ones you see at bakeries are the chocolate chip, but then it… -I grew up on the iced oatmeal ones. -Yes.
translation.ja: チョコチップもいいが オートミールもいい

translation.en: -Remember those? -Yes. Those were so good.
translation.ja: 大好きなクッキーだ

translation.en: I used to load Pepperidge Farm cookies onto trucks in Queens. -Stop it. -[Jon] We were kids in school.
translation.ja: ペパリッジファームの クッキーを子供の頃に積んだ

translation.en: The drivers would tip us.
translation.ja: クッキーがお駄賃さ

translation.en: -We'd wait by the distribution center. -That's a dream job.
translation.ja: クッキーがお駄賃さ 理想の仕事ね

translation.en: And we would go pick out their boxes and load up their trucks. -[Roy] And load it up. -Yeah. That was it.
translation.ja: 配送所で待ち構えて トラックに箱を積んだ

translation.en: -[Roy laughs] -[Christina] I love that.
translation.ja: すてき

translation.en: [Christina] This is flour, salt, baking powder, -baking soda. -[Jon] Right.
translation.ja: 小麦粉 塩 膨らし粉 そして重曹

translation.en: We know we need to add this, so the secret to this mixing is
translation.ja: 他の材料を混ぜる時のこつは

translation.en: that we want to mix this part of it as little as possible.
translation.ja: この行程をなるべく 手早くすること

translation.en: [Jon] Right.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [Christina] That's it.
translation.ja: いいわ

translation.en: [Jon] Is that all you would mix right there?
translation.ja: これが全材料？

translation.en: -[Christina] I'll mix this other stuff in. -[Jon] Because you'll do that too.
translation.ja: ええ これを全部混ぜるわ

translation.en: -[Christina] These are sea salt bars. -What are the biggest flaws you see
translation.ja: クッキー作りの 一番の間違いは何だと？

translation.en: in just everyday home-baking cookies? What I see is, it's either too chalky--
translation.ja: クッキー作りの 一番の間違いは何だと？ 例えば石のように固い クッキーとか

translation.en: -[Christina] Mm-hmm. Yes. -and hard as a rock.
translation.ja: 例えば石のように固い クッキーとか

translation.en: No one creams their butter and their sugar long enough.
translation.ja: バターを練る時間が

translation.en: -Yup. -Ever. It's like two seconds, zoom, zoom, zoom, we're done.
translation.ja: 足りなすぎるからだと思う

translation.en: Yeah. They're probably doing the first phase that long. They're doing the second phase as long as we did the first phase--
translation.ja: 第一段階が短くて 第二段階が長いのが原因？

translation.en: -They're doing this. -you gotta swap them.
translation.ja: そう 反対なの

translation.en: They overmix it, which is why you get the chalky, hard cookie.
translation.ja: 最後に混ぜすぎるから 固くなる

translation.en: -Once you add the flour-- -Like, the gluten forms?
translation.ja: グルテンの働き？

translation.en: -Yes. -You've taught him so well.
translation.ja: よく教えてるわ

translation.en: You're really getting… I don't ever tell anyone this stuff because it feels very…
translation.ja: 普通はそこまで説明しないの だって…

translation.en: -Nerdy? -Well, no, I like being a nerd,
translation.ja: 理屈っぽい？ いいえ 違うの

translation.en: but the details of it are overbearing in the spirit of something
translation.ja: いいえ 違うの 純粋な喜びを 台無しにしそうだから

translation.en: -that should be pure unadulterated joy. -No, you don't understand. It helps
translation.ja: 純粋な喜びを 台無しにしそうだから いや 後学のために 役に立つ知識だよ

translation.en: because once I understand the principles, I can apply it to other things.
translation.ja: いや 後学のために 役に立つ知識だよ

translation.en: Yes. It is funny if you think about that. You go to culinary school because you have to learn the basic technique.
translation.ja: 基礎知識が欲しいなら 料理学校に行くべきよ

translation.en: -Yes. -But the instinct is something
translation.ja: ああ でも口コミや試行錯誤に 頼る本能も大事よ

translation.en: that you pick up word-of-mouth -along the way. Trial and error. -Yeah.
translation.ja: でも口コミや試行錯誤に 頼る本能も大事よ

translation.en: You have to learn how other people do it to figure out what your palate wants.
translation.ja: 他の人の成功体験から学ぶの

translation.en: -Yes. -How someone seasons their cookie dough
translation.ja: ああ クッキー生地の味付けは 人によって違うわ

translation.en: is probably totally different than the way I do it.
translation.ja: クッキー生地の味付けは 人によって違うわ

translation.en: -Yes. -But I also bake like I'm a cook
translation.ja: ああ 私のクッキーは 他のプロから習った味なの

translation.en: because I liked hanging out with the savory cooks on my way up.
translation.ja: 私のクッキーは 他のプロから習った味なの

translation.en: You tasted, you went.
translation.ja: 味の試行錯誤よ

translation.en: So all of this ridiculous mass goes in.
translation.ja: これを全部 入れるわ

translation.en: That's so cool.
translation.ja: すごい

translation.en: [Christina] Chocolate. Marshmallows.
translation.ja: チョコレートにマシュマロ

translation.en: And then, for here, I'm pulsing like…
translation.ja: 電源を小刻みに…

translation.en: -[Jon] You're keeping it… -[Christina] That's it. …as short as you can, yeah? As far as…
translation.ja: 入れたり消したりして 混ぜるんだね？

translation.en: -[Roy] Wow, that was fast. -[Jon] Oh, wow.
translation.ja: 早いね

translation.en: [Christina] If you look at this dough, it's a very light-colored dough.
translation.ja: 色の薄い生地に見える

translation.en: [Jon] Yes.
translation.ja: ええ

translation.en: This looks like a Halloween cookie almost. You could add Reese's Pieces, orange--
translation.ja: リーシーズを足せば ハロウィーン用だ

translation.en: You could add so many different things into there.
translation.ja: いろいろ足せるわ

translation.en: I'm gonna put you on scooping duty. -[Jon] Yes. -[Christina] You've done your homework.
translation.ja: すくうのはジョンに任せる

translation.en: Fill the whole scooper and then bottoms it off with the palm of your hand.
translation.ja: 手を使って底まで詰めてね

translation.en: -[Jon] Salmonella. -[Christina] Please stop.
translation.ja: サルモネラ…

translation.en: These nice, little mountain tops are perfect because the cookie is largely butter.
translation.ja: バターがたっぷりだから 山盛りにしたほうがいい

translation.en: And so the taller we can make them, the less flat they'll get.
translation.ja: そのほうが ぺしゃんこにならない

translation.en: They go into the fridge and we get 'em super cold before they go into the oven.
translation.ja: 焼く前に 冷蔵庫で冷やしましょう

translation.en: -They keep their shape longer? -[Christina] Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: 形も崩れない

translation.en: -[Jon] Do they cook well-- -And we added so much extra butter in.
translation.ja: バターがたくさんだから

translation.en: We wanna give that butter a fighting chance before the heat hits it.
translation.ja: 焼く前に溶けないようにね

translation.en: -[Christina] All right, we're coming in. -[Roy] Hello. Wow.
translation.ja: さあ こっちよ

translation.en: [Jon growls] Here we are.
translation.ja: ここだね

translation.en: -[Christina] And that's it. -[Roy] Let's go.
translation.ja: ＯＫよ よし

translation.en: [Jon] And what's this?
translation.ja: 何？

translation.en: [Christina] This is a super deepened graham pie shell.
translation.ja: グラハムビスケットの パイ生地よ

translation.en: As long as I can add butter, sugar, salt, a little bit of milk powder,
translation.ja: バター 砂糖 塩 ミルクパウダーを入れれば

translation.en: -anything can be a crust. -[Jon] Wow.
translation.ja: パイ生地になるわ

translation.en: So this was your first, kind of, attempt--
translation.ja: つまり これが君の最初の…

translation.en: This is my first vehicle of dessert.
translation.ja: 最初のヒット商品よ

translation.en: …to define the bridge between who you were and who you're becoming?
translation.ja: 君の原点というわけ？

translation.en: Yeah. I was a crazy home baker before I moved to New York to go to culinary school and do all this stuff.
translation.ja: ＮＹの料理学校に行く前は 家でお菓子作りよ

translation.en: I never wanted to lose that piece of it
translation.ja: そのことを忘れたくない

translation.en: because I knew there was something there that was true to me.
translation.ja: それが本来の私だから

translation.en: -The home-baker side? Yeah. -[Christina] The home-baker side.
translation.ja: 家庭？ ええ 家庭の味

translation.en: When you're making a brownie at home, sometimes you swirl stuff in it.
translation.ja: 家で作る時 ブラウニーに 何かを混ぜるでしょ？

translation.en: Like, why can't you just put the batter of a brownie into a pie crust and bake it?
translation.ja: 家で作る時 ブラウニーに 何かを混ぜるでしょ？ 私はこれを混ぜる

translation.en: Like, why not? The graham that's in the brownie batter will start to bridge
translation.ja: どう？ ブラウニーの中の ビスケットが懸け橋よ

translation.en: what will happen on your palate.
translation.ja: ブラウニーの中の ビスケットが懸け橋よ

translation.en: [Roy] Going back to bake sales, the most flaws I usually encounter are, they're chalky. Where is that coming from for the--
translation.ja: バザーでありがちなのが パサパサのブラウニーだ

translation.en: -The chalkiness? It's bad chocolate. -[Roy] …average home baker?
translation.ja: チョコの質が原因よ

translation.en: Yes. Don't skimp on the ingredient, right?
translation.ja: 材料が安物？

translation.en: [Christina] Yes.
translation.ja: そう

translation.en: There's really no substitution for really good chocolate, really good cocoa powder. The darker, the deeper, the better.
translation.ja: 上質のチョコやココアは 色も味も深みがあるわ

translation.en: You don't just go to the supermarket, buy the chips or the nibs and melt it?
translation.ja: スーパーのチョコチップは？

translation.en: I do when I'm using chocolate chips because they're semi-sweet.
translation.ja: 私は使うわ 甘すぎないし どうせ一流職人は作らない

translation.en: Also the fancy chocolate people don't make mini chocolate chips.
translation.ja: 甘すぎないし どうせ一流職人は作らない

translation.en: -Yeah. -[all laugh]
translation.ja: 確かに

translation.en: [Christina] So take that out of the bowl.
translation.ja: ボウルから出して

translation.en: -[Jon] These guys? Okay. -[Christina] Yeah. Let me get spoons
translation.ja: これを？ スプーンで味見を

translation.en: so we can taste it.
translation.ja: スプーンで味見を

translation.en: [Jon] Dang.
translation.ja: おっと

translation.en: [Jon] Wanna lick?
translation.ja: 早く

translation.en: You always know who's on the chocolate station when you walk into the kitchen because they're always…
translation.ja: 台所でチョコの 盗み食いをしたら絶対バレる

translation.en: -It's impossible. You're being covered-- -Me, it'd be my face covered with it.
translation.ja: 台所でチョコの 盗み食いをしたら絶対バレる チョコだらけだ

translation.en: [Christina] And this just goes straight into the pie crust.
translation.ja: パイ生地に流し込んで

translation.en: -[Jon] And it'll settle on its own? -[Chrisitna] It'll settle on its own.
translation.ja: このままで？ そうね

translation.en: There's little graham compared to what you're doing with the cookie because it's disappeared and been incorporated.
translation.ja: ビスケットがよく混ざって 目立たないね

translation.en: Yes. And it starts to break up a little bit, so it's almost like a graham-y brownie batter.
translation.ja: まるで グラハム粉のブラウニーよ

translation.en: [Jon] I can see what you're saying.
translation.ja: なるほどね

translation.en: [Christina] One of my favorite things with chocolate
translation.ja: チョコレートのいい点は

translation.en: is to play off of the acidity with another acidity.
translation.ja: 酸味で酸味を消すところよ

translation.en: And my favorite thing in that space is mint.
translation.ja: その空白にミントがいい

translation.en: Mint has a zest, but it also has a bite to it.
translation.ja: 香り付けだけでなく 食べられる

translation.en: So we make this strangely gooey mixture.
translation.ja: では不思議な味の “ねばねば”を作ろう

translation.en: This is white chocolate. You don't have to spend that much money because nice white chocolate is
translation.ja: 安いホワイトチョコで 構わないわ

translation.en: -all the same thing. -It's just milk, solid.
translation.ja: どれも同じだから

translation.en: [Christina] We add cream cheese. Some oil.
translation.ja: クリームチーズと油を足す

translation.en: -[Jon] What, grape seed? -[Christina] I like grape seed.
translation.ja: 何の？ 色や香りの薄い ブドウ種油などが

translation.en: We only use a flavorless, colorless oil
translation.ja: 色や香りの薄い ブドウ種油などが

translation.en: -unless we want the oil to have a role. -I see.
translation.ja: 邪魔にならなくていい

translation.en: We add confectioner's sugar. I'll let you pop that in.
translation.ja: 粉砂糖を入れてちょうだい

translation.en: [Jon] Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: The secret to anything that you want to taste like a great mint
translation.ja: 隠し味に一番いいのは

translation.en: is a mixture of peppermint and spearmint as extracts.
translation.ja: ペパーミントと スペアミントのミックスよ

translation.en: [Roy] You combine with the food coloring?
translation.ja: 着色料も？

translation.en: -[Christina] Exactly. -[Jon] I see.
translation.ja: 大当たり

translation.en: [Christina] We'll take it and dollop it into different places on this pie.
translation.ja: 生地の上のあちこちに 落としていくの

translation.en: [Jon] Look how pretty she makes her top.
translation.ja: すごくきれい

translation.en: [Christina] So I'm basically making little cheesecake swirl.
translation.ja: 渦巻きを作ってね

translation.en: -Look how cool. -Oh, yeah.
translation.ja: すばらしい

translation.en: See, you're acting like it's nothing, you just whatever. There's such an effortlessness.
translation.ja: まるで何でもないように やっているね

translation.en: But this is also, like, years of being like, 10, 11, 12-year-old
translation.ja: 10歳ぐらいの時から つまようじで

translation.en: with my toothpick in my mom's home kitchen--
translation.ja: これをやってたの

translation.en: Yes.
translation.ja: へえ

translation.en: …trying to figure out how to get the swirls just right.
translation.ja: 渦巻き模様を研究してた

translation.en: Each one of them is the same, and yet each one of them is a little different.
translation.ja: 同じパターンでも 微妙に違うの

translation.en: Do you sell this at Milk Bar?
translation.ja: 店の商品？

translation.en: -[Christina] For special occasions. -[Roy] Okay.
translation.ja: 特別な時だけ

translation.en: And then we give it a little ring around of mini marshmallows and mini chocolate chips.
translation.ja: 周りを小粒のマシュマロと チョコで囲むの

translation.en: [Jon] High-end marshmallows don't always lead to better… -S'mores. Yeah. -…baked products. No.
translation.ja: 高級マシュマロも スモアーズには負ける

translation.en: They don't. Because they're all natural and all that.
translation.ja: そうね　歌も覚えてるわ

translation.en: So you've embraced your childhood flavors
translation.ja: 昔の味が懐かしい？

translation.en: -and products. -[Christina] I love the childhood flavors.
translation.ja: ええ 大好きよ

translation.en: I think where Christina and I are similar in cooking is, we will mix high and low together.
translation.ja: 僕と彼女の共通点は 高級と庶民の味の融合だ

translation.en: That's right.
translation.ja: まさに

translation.en: A lot of chefs, sometimes, are too snooty to do that.
translation.ja: どんなに気取っても

translation.en: -[Jon] That's a good point. -But sometimes you can't replace a old-fashioned marshmallow.
translation.ja: 昔ながらのマシュマロには かなわない

translation.en: I believe that, like, everyone wants to be spoken to on some level. Everyone's in search of connection.
translation.ja: 誰もが人とのつながりを 求めてると思うの

translation.en: And with food, the easiest way to speak to someone
translation.ja: それには食べ物が一番

translation.en: -is through something they already know. -[Jon] So beautiful.
translation.ja: 皆が知ってることだもの 完璧

translation.en: -That's it. We put it on a sheet tray. -Beautiful. -[Christina] Off to the oven. -Is this it?
translation.ja: トレイに乗せて 焼きましょう

translation.en: -This is the first one. -[Jon] Is that it?
translation.ja: さっきのだ

translation.en: [Christina] Once it gets baked off.
translation.ja: 焼き上がったものよ

translation.en: -We'll bake this one off so it's true. -We'll bake it, but we don't have to
translation.ja: 焼き上がったものよ なぜ焼いたものが？

translation.en: pretend this is it.
translation.ja: なぜ焼いたものが？

translation.en: The other thing we do is, we Jackson Pollock glaze the top
translation.ja: 現代アートを施すためよ

translation.en: -before-- -Do we have to do that?
translation.ja: これに描くの？

translation.en: [Jon] What's this you're making?
translation.ja: 何を？

translation.en: -[Christina] This is just a mint drizzle. -[Jon] A drizzle? [Christina] And then we Jackson Pollock the pie.
translation.ja: ジャクソン･ポロック風に ミントを垂らすの

translation.en: You stand on a ladder above it and--
translation.ja: 台の上から？

translation.en: We just stand a little above it and start to give it the splatter.
translation.ja: 高い所から はね散らすようにね

translation.en: Do you want to Jackson Pollock?
translation.ja: やってみて

translation.en: -I'll give it a shot. -[Christina] All right.
translation.ja: 挑戦しよう

translation.en: -[Jon] How am I doing here? -[Christina] Good. [Jon] Now go the other way?
translation.ja: どうかな？ やり過ぎかな？

translation.en: -Am I going too-- -[Christina] You're good.
translation.ja: どうかな？ やり過ぎかな？ じょうずよ

translation.en: You pull it out from under me when I'm going too far.
translation.ja: どこで止めれば？

translation.en: [Christina] There's no right or wrong way.
translation.ja: 正解はないわ

translation.en: Do you want to add to this?
translation.ja: 君もどうぞ

translation.en: -This? -Chef?
translation.ja: 僕？

translation.en: -[Christina] He needs to… [laughs] -[Jon] That's the one--
translation.ja: ええ 彼も… 一振りだ

translation.en: You wanna cut into this sucker?
translation.ja: 切ってみて

translation.en: They taught me in school the most important part is tasting.
translation.ja: 試食が大事と習った

translation.en: -Is tasting. -[Christina] Tasting.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: -[Jon] Cuts easy, don't it? -[Christina] Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: 簡単だ

translation.en: We bake it. It poofs. And then…
translation.ja: ついに出来た

translation.en: I don't know about you, but I like a fudgy-in-the-center brownie.
translation.ja: 私は真ん中の部分が好きよ

translation.en: -Yes. -You got it. I can feel it already.
translation.ja: そうだと思ったよ

translation.en: [Christina] Nice.
translation.ja: いいわ

translation.en: -[Jon] That's really good. -That's a bake sale. They're so good.
translation.ja: バザーで大人気だ

translation.en: Right? The textures are so great.
translation.ja: 食感がいい

translation.en: [Christina] Texture of the marshmallows on top, I just cannot get away from. I'll go around and pick them off of every bite.
translation.ja: 周りに乗ってる マシュマロの食感が最高

translation.en: [Jon] It's really good.
translation.ja: うまい

translation.en: [Roy] Well, we solved the cookie and the brownie. Now, we got the cake.
translation.ja: 次はケーキを作るんだね

translation.en: You can't come to Milk Bar without making a layer cake.
translation.ja: レイヤーケーキは人気

translation.en: -Yes. -[Roy] Layer cake.
translation.ja: なるほど

translation.en: -Few more steps than a cookie, but worth-- -However,
translation.ja: クッキーより複雑よ

translation.en: I was thrown when I saw the mise because I've never seen that in a layer cake.
translation.ja: これがレイヤーケーキの 材料とはね

translation.en: You're here, so why the heck not -roll out the red carpet? -Why not?
translation.ja: 高級食材がお好みなの？

translation.en: It's a recipe we've been working on for a few months
translation.ja: 数ヵ月かかった 誕生日ケーキのレシピよ

translation.en: -since we came out with the birthday cake. -This is the chocolate birthday cake?
translation.ja: 数ヵ月かかった 誕生日ケーキのレシピよ チョコケーキ？

translation.en: It's the chocolate birthday cake because not everyone is here for all the vanilla.
translation.ja: もちろんよ バニラとは限らない

translation.en: [Christina] Mixing cake is like mixing a cookie, -in theory. -Right.
translation.ja: 最初はクッキーと同じよ

translation.en: -It starts with butter. Get it in there. -[Roy] Cream. Cream first.
translation.ja: まずバターを練って

translation.en: [Christina] We're gonna add light brown sugar and granulated sugar.
translation.ja: ブラウンシュガーと グラニュー糖

translation.en: And then ditto with the dark vanilla extract
translation.ja: 同様に黒いバニラエッセンス

translation.en: because chocolate cake should be dark and rich.
translation.ja: ダークでリッチな味にする

translation.en: So we take a bunch of eggs, and we blend them down for our cakes.
translation.ja: 卵を入れて よく混ぜ合わせる

translation.en: How do you know how many eggs you're adding?
translation.ja: 卵は何個？

translation.en: We weigh them. A large egg is about 50 grams.
translation.ja: １個50グラムで量ってね

translation.en: -We try to pour the oil in first. -What's this on the bottom?
translation.ja: 油を注ぎましょう 何？

translation.en: That's buttermilk. We layer our oil and our buttermilk.
translation.ja: 下に沈んでるのが バターミルクよ

translation.en: Oil is always the key to moist cake?
translation.ja: 油の役割は？

translation.en: -[Christina] Oil is the key to moist cake. -[Jon] Buttermilk, now you have your acid.
translation.ja: しっとりさせる 酸と脂肪も加わるね

translation.en: -You have your fat. -[Christina] Exactly.
translation.ja: 酸と脂肪も加わるね そうよ

translation.en: [Jon] If it's not looking glossy, what do you add more of?
translation.ja: 様子を見て何かを足す？

translation.en: -You just keep-- -Blending?
translation.ja: ひたすら混ぜ続けるの

translation.en: You keep blending. Again, it's the most common mistake.
translation.ja: ひたすら混ぜ続けるの よくある間違いよ

translation.en: You don't want to change measurements because it's chemistry.
translation.ja: 化学だから分量を変えない？

translation.en: -You don't just start-- -It's science.
translation.ja: 化学だから分量を変えない？ そうよ

translation.en: -[Jon] So all of your control-- -I'll just add a little bit more oil.
translation.ja: つまり― “油を足そうか”

translation.en: -No, but we do. -[Christina] Yeah.
translation.ja: ああ 僕らはやりがちだ

translation.en: That's what we do. So you're manipulating all of it
translation.ja: ああ 僕らはやりがちだ つまり 全てが計算されてる？

translation.en: -through time and-- -And it's time and agitations.
translation.ja: つまり 全てが計算されてる？ 時間やかくはんもよ

translation.en: That's where things go wrong. Remember when we were making the beignets?
translation.ja: それが原因だ ベニエを作った時 少し材料を足したよな？

translation.en: We were adding and changing the ratios a little bit.
translation.ja: ベニエを作った時 少し材料を足したよな？

translation.en: -[Roy] A little bit. -Yeah. [groans] Du Monde?
translation.ja: もしやデュモンド？

translation.en: Yeah, but it was three years old.
translation.ja: ３年前のだった

translation.en: I think I have a three-year-old box of Café Du Monde.
translation.ja: 私も持ってるわ

translation.en: No, we got a fresh box, and we redid it.
translation.ja: 買い直した

translation.en: [Christina] This is cake flour, baking powder, salt.
translation.ja: ケーキ用小麦粉 膨らし粉 塩

translation.en: [Jon] Now we wanna go-- -[Christina] As little as possible. -…short, high-speed short,
translation.ja: “高速の短時間”で？

translation.en: -or medium-speed short? -Medium-speed short.
translation.ja: 中速で短時間よ

translation.en: We want to mix it for as little as humanly possible.
translation.ja: できるだけ短時間でね

translation.en: -[Jon] Now, probably stop it. -[Christina] You can stop it.
translation.ja: 出来た？ もういいわ

translation.en: -Scrape it? -And my method is always you can finish mixing anything and everything by hand.
translation.ja: 最後は手で混ぜるのが 私の流儀よ

translation.en: [Jon] So it's folding more -because you don't want to collapse it? -[Christina] Yeah.
translation.ja: 潰さないよう折り混ぜる？

translation.en: I'm so proud. I could just retire. You could take my job for me. He's on it.
translation.ja: 私の跡を継いでほしいほど うまいわ

translation.en: I'm just here for show. He's doin' it all.
translation.ja: 僕はお飾りだね

translation.en: [Christina] So the batter goes in.
translation.ja: ここへ

translation.en: [Jon] Just do this?
translation.ja: こう？

translation.en: [Christina] Yeah, exactly. You're spreading them in.
translation.ja: そして全体に広げる

translation.en: [Jon] I see.
translation.ja: ＯＫ

translation.en: -[Christina] Perfect. -[Jon] Okay.
translation.ja: 完璧よ よし

translation.en: [Christina] This side of the spatula is 90 degrees.
translation.ja: へらの横の角度は90度

translation.en: So rather than bring my spatula back, I get a little batter underneath it.
translation.ja: だから へらの下側に 生地を付けて

translation.en: And then just wedge it into the corners.
translation.ja: 隅を埋めていくのよ

translation.en: There we go.
translation.ja: そうか

translation.en: And then, for this guy, because, even though it's cake, we still love texture,
translation.ja: ケーキといえども 食感が大事だから

translation.en: we just sprinkle some of our nice mini little chocolate chips.
translation.ja: チョコチップを散らす

translation.en: This is a very fancy cake batter, and that's well and good,
translation.ja: 完璧なケーキ生地でも

translation.en: but, like, you can't take the girl out of the suburbs. A little bit.
translation.ja: チョコチップは どうしても欠かせない

translation.en: And what's your go-to mini chip?
translation.ja: お薦めは？

translation.en: [Christina] Anything that's semi-sweet is nice. Milk chocolate is saved
translation.ja: セミスイート味ね ミルク味ならリーシーズ

translation.en: for my Hershey's candy bar,
translation.ja: ミルク味ならリーシーズ

translation.en: -Reese's Peanut Butter Cup… Yeah. -For eating it directly.
translation.ja: ミルク味ならリーシーズ 直接でもいい

translation.en: [Christina] This goes in the oven 15, 20 minutes.
translation.ja: オーブンで15～20分

translation.en: [Jon] Okay.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: -[Roy] All right. Cake? -[Christina] Chocolate cake.
translation.ja: チョコケーキよ

translation.en: A cake is done just as it starts to pull back from the edges.
translation.ja: 端が浮き上がったら 焼き上がりよ

translation.en: In order to start working with him,
translation.ja: まずケーキを 型から出しましょう

translation.en: -we just have to take him out of the pan. -[Jon] I see.
translation.ja: まずケーキを 型から出しましょう ＯＫ

translation.en: [Christina] They pop out, and this piece comes back really easily.
translation.ja: 出して 紙は簡単にはがれる

translation.en: -And you just smack them. -And just literally…yeah. Boom.
translation.ja: 思い切り　ドン！

translation.en: [Jon] That was really fun. Okay.
translation.ja: 実に楽しいね

translation.en: -[Christina] You're a pro already. -[Jon] There we go.
translation.ja: もうプロだわ

translation.en: Look at that.
translation.ja: これ見て

translation.en: [Christina] We know we need to cut it into rounds.
translation.ja: 丸く切り出すわ

translation.en: So why didn't you just make your first cakes into a rectangle?
translation.ja: 長方形のままではダメ？

translation.en: That's a good question. Because this is nostalgia.
translation.ja: 丸い形が郷愁を誘うの

translation.en: A rectangle cake doesn't make sense, -doesn't tug on my heartstrings. -Yeah. Okay. Yeah.
translation.ja: 四角いケーキじゃ 琴線に触れない

translation.en: You don't need three great rounds to make a great cake. You only need one really great round.
translation.ja: 完全な丸が１つあればいい

translation.en: -For the top. -[Christina] You…For the top.
translation.ja: 一番上のため

translation.en: That's one nice round.
translation.ja: 完璧な丸よ

translation.en: Another as nice of a round as you can get. [Jon, Christina] For the bottom.
translation.ja: もう１つの丸は 真ん中の部分よ

translation.en: [Christina] And then two almost--
translation.ja: 残りの部分で

translation.en: -[Jon] Halves. -…half moons. Exactly.
translation.ja: 半円を２つ作るの

translation.en: And the chocolate chips, you gotta give them a little pounding.
translation.ja: チョコチップを散らす

translation.en: So you get one full three-layer cake out of one flat?
translation.ja: ３層のケーキが 出来るんだね？

translation.en: Out of one quarter-sheet pan, exactly.
translation.ja: 長方形からね

translation.en: [Jon] Roy, I'm getting into your area here.
translation.ja: ロイの所に侵入だ

translation.en: -Is that all right? -[Christina] Territory.
translation.ja: 陣地合戦ね

translation.en: [Jon] We're gonna make this perfect now.
translation.ja: 出来たぞ

translation.en: [Christina] Perfect. These rings are gonna be our new friends.
translation.ja: また丸型を使うから きれいに拭いて

translation.en: -Give 'em a little dust down. -Like a plating cylinder?
translation.ja: また丸型を使うから きれいに拭いて 磨くよ

translation.en: There you go. Look at you. Did you learn that from Wolfgang?
translation.ja: 有名シェフから学んだ？

translation.en: I learned it from Roy. Everything.
translation.ja: ロイが師匠だ

translation.en: [Christina] Ring on cardboard becomes our new canvas.
translation.ja: 厚紙の上に丸型を置いて

translation.en: -This stuff is acetate. -Yes.
translation.ja: このアセテートがガイド役よ

translation.en: -[Christina] So we use that as a guide. -[Jon] Okay.
translation.ja: このアセテートがガイド役よ ＯＫ

translation.en: -[Christina] We're gonna build from here. -[Jon] Mm-hmm.
translation.ja: ここに立てて

translation.en: [Christina] We're going to put our two-- -[Jon] Halves. -…half moons down first.
translation.ja: 最初に ２個の半月形を敷いてね

translation.en: -[Jon] The sad round. -[Christina] The sad rounds!
translation.ja: 残念な丸だ

translation.en: And then we're gonna use the one off scraps.
translation.ja: 余った部分を使って

translation.en: -[Jon] So spread it. -We'll break them down -to fill in the negative space. -[Jon] I see.
translation.ja: ちぎって溝を埋めていくの

translation.en: [Christina] So this is a soak. It's a vanilla-scented soak.
translation.ja: バニラの香りの液に浸すわ

translation.en: It's the dreamy vanilla vibe, so it's a little bit of that clear vanilla extract.
translation.ja: 甘い香りの 白いバニラエッセンス入りよ

translation.en: You're putting about three spoonfuls of that soak down.
translation.ja: スプーン３杯ほど たっぷりね

translation.en: [Jon] So moisture and flavor--
translation.ja: しっとりする

translation.en: [Christina] Moisture and flavor are key here.
translation.ja: それと香りのためよ

translation.en: [Jon] What's this one?
translation.ja: 何？

translation.en: [Christina] This is birthday frosting. This is our from-scratch version of it.
translation.ja: 手作りのアイシングよ

translation.en: I put down usually three heaping spoonfuls.
translation.ja: スプーン山盛り３杯を

translation.en: And you're gonna do the same figure-eight ellipses.
translation.ja: ８の字に楕円を描いてね

translation.en: You just want to keep your spoon in the frosting. Poking at it will pull the layer of cake up.
translation.ja: スプーンでアイシングを 立たせるようにね

translation.en: [Jon] Okay.
translation.ja: ＯＫ

translation.en: These are birthday crumbs. Spread 'em around.
translation.ja: クラムスを全体に散らして

translation.en: And then, just to anchor them into the frosting.
translation.ja: アイシングに埋め込む

translation.en: [Roy] Okay.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: So once crumb goes down-- -More frosting? -More frosting.
translation.ja: その上に さらにアイシングを

translation.en: All right.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: So we're gonna do the same thing all over. Cake, soak, frosting, crumb, frosting.
translation.ja: さらにケーキを乗せて 繰り返してね

translation.en: I actually gotta go to a birthday party after this.
translation.ja: 誕生会に行こう

translation.en: -No way. -This is perfect, yeah.
translation.ja: 行けるな

translation.en: [Jon] I'll sell you mine.
translation.ja: 売ろうか？

translation.en: -Yeah. -[all laugh]
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: Your favorite memory of birthday cake, do you have one?
translation.ja: 思い出のケーキは？

translation.en: -[Jon] Roy? -I like lemon cake, I would say.
translation.ja: ロイ？ レモンケーキ

translation.en: The zing of it or the gooey pound-cake vibe?
translation.ja: 韓国ではどんなタイプが？

translation.en: Both. Koreans grow up with pound-cake-type cake.
translation.ja: 主にパウンドケーキ

translation.en: -[Jon] Really? -Yeah.
translation.ja: 本当？

translation.en: My memories are the Entenmann's that everybody sneaks in at midnight
translation.ja: 僕の思い出は エンテンマンだな

translation.en: -to have more and disappears by morning. -But crumb cake? Like Entenmann's--
translation.ja: 僕の思い出は エンテンマンだな クラムケーキ？

translation.en: Crumb cake's good. And whatever that cheesecake, -strudel-type thing… -[Christina] Oh, yeah.
translation.ja: チーズケーキや ペストリーなどだ

translation.en: [Jon] Uh-oh…No more frosting.
translation.ja: 使い切った

translation.en: This is that anxiety that comes with doing this at home.
translation.ja: 家で起きる問題だ

translation.en: [Christina] I know.
translation.ja: そうね

translation.en: See, now this really is like bake sale.
translation.ja: バザーのあるあるだ

translation.en: But this is right. This is the humanity of what happens in the kitchen.
translation.ja: 皆の台所で よく起きることよ

translation.en: [Jon] I'm gonna put one dollop in the middle. I'd cry.
translation.ja: これでおしまいだ

translation.en: [Christina] Your friend would be like, "Hold on, I got…"
translation.ja: ちょっと待って

translation.en: [Jon] I have extra.
translation.ja: 僕のあげるよ

translation.en: Now we're talking. -There you go. -Gimme another layer.
translation.ja: 来た！ もう一層作れる

translation.en: [Christina] You're so… I know, right? Build it to the sky.
translation.ja: ええ どんどん足して

translation.en: [Jon] Now I'm happy. Look at this.
translation.ja: いいね　どうだい？

translation.en: [Christina] The best is, you can make the top as crazy as you want. -Once you pull the sides up-- -[Roy] That's pretty.
translation.ja: トップは好きなだけ盛れる

translation.en: -[Christina] Yes! -[Jon] It's called Bart Simpson. Eraserhead.
translation.ja: バート･シンプソンだ

translation.en: [Christina] Look at you! It means business.
translation.ja: いい仕事してるわ

translation.en: [Jon] That's very pretty, Roy, I have to say.
translation.ja: ロイ いいだろ？

translation.en: [Christina] He's got it.
translation.ja: 完璧よ

translation.en: -We're going to the freezer, guys. -[Roy] In the freezer? Okay.
translation.ja: さあ 冷凍庫へ

translation.en: [Christina] We're gonna go in the Mr. Freeze deep freeze.
translation.ja: 冷凍庫の一番奥に入れて

translation.en: [Jon] This is the one where you get somebody to confess.
translation.ja: ここで拷問を？

translation.en: [Christina] Yeah! Yeah! Where did you put the milk?
translation.ja: “ミルクはどこだ！”とね

translation.en: Whenever I see this, I feel like I'm on Game of Thrones. -Yeah. -This one? Oh, the Wall.
translation.ja: 「ゲーム･オブ･ スローンズ」ね

translation.en: [Roy] There we go.
translation.ja: それ

translation.en: -[Jon] Should we check on the cookies? -[Christina] Yeah, I'm ready.
translation.ja: クッキーを見よう

translation.en: [Christina] Gentlemen…
translation.ja: どうぞ―

translation.en: Feast your eyes. Look at those things.
translation.ja: 自分の目で確かめて

translation.en: -Excellent. -The marshmallows, you can see them popping out in a gooey way.
translation.ja: マシュマロが飛び出てるのに

translation.en: And you can tell, because there's no blowouts,
translation.ja: 生地は割れてない

translation.en: we mixed them all properly. You see the little jewels of it.
translation.ja: 混ぜ方が正しかったのね

translation.en: It was perfectly scooped is what we can tell.
translation.ja: すくい方が完璧

translation.en: What I'm gauging here is that it's perfectly scooped,
translation.ja: 確かに　そして―

translation.en: but for me that is… the moment of it.
translation.ja: この瞬間が最高なの

translation.en: [Jon] I like it so much more
translation.ja: 予想以上の味だね

translation.en: -now I know what's in it. -[Roy] It's delicious.
translation.ja: 予想以上の味だね おいしい

translation.en: [Christina] We crushed that.
translation.ja: 大成功

translation.en: All these cake scraps, we don't throw 'em away. We make 'em into cake truffles.
translation.ja: ケーキの残りで トリュフを作る

translation.en: They become the truffles? Okay. -[Christina] Yeah.
translation.ja: トリュフだね？

translation.en: We put them all into a bowl.
translation.ja: ボウルに入れる

translation.en: We break them down. And then we add that same cake soak.
translation.ja: 砕いて さっきの浸し液をかけるの

translation.en: And then you're gonna knead it almost as you would a bread dough.
translation.ja: パン生地のように練ってね

translation.en: Compress it. It's already baked, so you're not worried about -developing gluten. -[Jon] Right.
translation.ja: 焼いてるから グルテンの心配はない

translation.en: [Christina] And from there, we use these scoops.
translation.ja: これですくってね

translation.en: Fill 'em, compress 'em, and we lay them out to the side there.
translation.ja: 丸めて形にしたら脇に置いて

translation.en: Roy, I'll scoop. You roll.
translation.ja: 共同作業よ

translation.en: We sell so many of these puppies that,
translation.ja: 大人気の商品だから

translation.en: when we get down, like, we get down as a team.
translation.ja: チームになって作るの

translation.en: You come. Someone's in charge of mixing. Someone's in charge of scooping. Someone's in charge of rolling.
translation.ja: 混ぜる係 すくう係 丸める係に分かれる

translation.en: What's the best music for making these?
translation.ja: ＢＧＭは？

translation.en: [sighs] I think you need a very quick beat that's also a little screamy
translation.ja: アップテンポの かけ声付きの曲ね

translation.en: because it's like going to boot camp. It's like, "Go!" [screams]
translation.ja: 軍隊の訓練みたいに “行け！”

translation.en: -How many of these you go through? -Thousands of them.
translation.ja: 数は？ 何千個も作る

translation.en: On a week, we probably sell eight to ten thousand cake truffles.
translation.ja: 週に8000～１万個くらい 売れるわ

translation.en: So this is that birthday crumb with a little bit more chocolate.
translation.ja: これはクラムスに チョコを足したものを

translation.en: And we broke it down to a sandy.
translation.ja: 粉状に砕いたの

translation.en: This is white chocolate that is mixed with a little bit of oil
translation.ja: ホワイトチョコに 少し油を混ぜたから

translation.en: so that it's nice and thin.
translation.ja: べたつかない

translation.en: [Christina] We're gonna white chocolate hands, -throw it over to Roy. -[Jon] Fried chicken.
translation.ja: ホワイトチョコを付けたら

translation.en: [Christina] Roy is going to rake it and then pull it.
translation.ja: クラムスにくぐらせる

translation.en: -And then as soon as it sets… -[Jon] Warm. …it's ready to eat or ready to package.
translation.ja: すぐに箱詰めしても 食べてもいい

translation.en: It's chocolate, vanilla, and a truffle. So you can get some really primo bake-sale vibe.
translation.ja: チョコバニラのトリュフは バザーの高級品よ

translation.en: Taste some of it.
translation.ja: 試食して

translation.en: The second this sets, there's a little of that shard of texture of white chocolate.
translation.ja: ホワイトチョコの殻が 味わえるでしょ？

translation.en: -This one's gonna be a hit. -That one's gonna be a hit.
translation.ja: 売れるね ええ

translation.en: [Roy] So we have our bake sale now.
translation.ja: バザー開始だ

translation.en: [Jon] You'd get that new library--
translation.ja: 新しい図書館が建つ

translation.en: [Christina] In my imagination, this is what a bake sale should look like.
translation.ja: 新しい図書館が建つ バザーの理想的姿ね

translation.en: You show up to a bake sale with that, you got two secret weapons.
translation.ja: 君が売れば鬼に金棒だ

translation.en: All of a sudden, you're in a different realm. -You're in a different territory. -[Roy] You're parent of the year.
translation.ja: “今年の保護者”に 選ばれるかもね

translation.en: [Jon] Lightning round. If I go to the ice cream parlor, I'll get vanilla.
translation.ja: 僕は― バニラアイスが好き

translation.en: [Christina] I'm a vanilla-ice-cream person.
translation.ja: 私もバニラが好き

translation.en: [Roy] For ice cream, vanilla milkshake, chocolate.
translation.ja: 僕はミルクセーキ

translation.en: -[Jon] Really? -[Roy] The problem growing up is my mom
translation.ja: へえ だが母のミキサーは キムチ臭い

translation.en: -used the same blender for kimchi. -[Jon] Acid. You want acid.
translation.ja: だが母のミキサーは キムチ臭い 酸が取れる

translation.en: -[Christina] A little funk. -[all laugh]
translation.ja: 少し残念 日本語字幕　川島 留美子
